intro: Trianosperma triangulare, commonly known as the triangular spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive triangular leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
